io.vertx.core.http.impl

Class HttpServerRequestImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.core.http.impl.HttpServerRequestImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpServerRequest, ReadStream<Buffer>, StreamBase

    public class HttpServerRequestImpl
extends Object
implements HttpServerRequest
    This class is optimised for performance when used on the same event loop that is was passed to the handler with. However it can be used safely from other threads. The internal state is protected using the synchronized keyword. If always used on the same event loop, then we benefit from biased locking which makes the overhead of synchronized near zero.
    Author:
    Tim Fox

      • headers

        public MultiMap headers()
        Description copied from interface: HttpServerRequest
        A map of all headers in the request, If the request contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here. The headers will be automatically lower-cased when they reach the server
        Specified by:
        headers in interface HttpServerRequest

      • bodyHandler

        public HttpServerRequest bodyHandler(Handler<Buffer> bodyHandler)
        Description copied from interface: HttpServerRequest
        Convenience method for receiving the entire request body in one piece. This saves the user having to manually set a data and end handler and append the chunks of the body until the whole body received. Don't use this if your request body is large - you could potentially run out of RAM.
        Specified by:
        bodyHandler in interface HttpServerRequest
        Parameters:
        bodyHandler - This handler will be called after all the body has been received

      • netSocket

        public NetSocket netSocket()
        Description copied from interface: HttpServerRequest
        Get a net socket for the underlying connection of this request. USE THIS WITH CAUTION! Writing to the socket directly if you don't know what you're doing can easily break the HTTP protocol
        Specified by:
        netSocket in interface HttpServerRequest
        Returns:
        the net socket

      • uploadHandler

        public HttpServerRequest uploadHandler(Handler<HttpServerFileUpload> handler)
        Description copied from interface: HttpServerRequest
        Set the upload handler. The handler will get notified once a new file upload was received and so allow to get notified by the upload in progress.
        Specified by:
        uploadHandler in interface HttpServerRequest

      • formAttributes

        public MultiMap formAttributes()
        Description copied from interface: HttpServerRequest
        Returns a map of all form attributes which was found in the request. Be aware that this message should only get called after the endHandler was notified as the map will be filled on-the-fly. HttpServerRequest.setExpectMultipart(boolean) must be called first before trying to get the formAttributes
        Specified by:
        formAttributes in interface HttpServerRequest
